name: Reception of Victor Emmanuel II at the Guildhall
obverse: Bust of Victor Emmanuel II facing left.
obverse_inscriptions: VICTORIUS EMMANUEL II REX SARDINIAE IN LONDINIUM A PRAESIDE CIVIBUSQUE RECEPTUS
reverse: Londinia standing besides Britannia who is seated as they both greet Sardinia. All three are wearing helmets. Sardinia is carrying a shield while Britain's shield sits between Londinia and Britannia. The coat of arms of the City of London sits at the bottom.
description: This medal is #8 of the City of London series. 350 specimens were struck.
Victor Emmanuel II was King of Sardinia
from 23 March 1849 until 17 March 1861, when he assumed the title of King of Italy.
